content.description: Short technical/hard small pocket crux at start and fun deep pockets at the finish.
content.location: On back of spire opposite "The Chief"

content.description: Climb the narrow slab (5.6) just right of the chimney or the chimney (5.6) to the summit of the pinnacle. Descend by lowering off your partner, who anchors the rope while you rappel off the opposite (north) side of the pinnacle.
content.protection: Cams 0.5-1" and 2.5". No permanent anchor at the summit. Set up an anchor by sticking a 2.5" cam (BD C3) straight down into a shallow pocket on the flat summit of the pillar and slinging a block at the back edge of the pillar.
content.location: Slab on the downhill side of the pinnacle below Kola.

content.description: The easiest start is on the right side of the face. Traverse left under the arching overhang past the first overhanging crack (which is another route, Old Spice 5.9), ascend a crack through a small and easy overhang (5.7), continue up a slab and finish on a steep headwall (5.7) protected by a nut (and a marginal cam) in a thin flaring crack. To descend, rappel the route or walk left (west) and downclimb a short (10') class 4 section at the end of the rock.Old Yeller is another variation going further around the end instead of up the crack, it is 5.7 as well.
content.protection: Cams and nuts up to 2". At the top there is an unnecessary double-bolt anchor with quick links for rappelling (good cracks for gear).
content.location: Rock just uphill from War Party and The Chief, and below Hummingbird Spire. a.k.a. the third rock up from shute-mills main wall that Mystery Hole is on. (Rock at 38.651467, -122.618525)P.S. There is also a nice afternoon shade spot near here

content.description: Start on the right side of the face, traverse left under the arching overhang and ascend the first crack through an overhang (5.9). Continue up a slab and finish on Old Tradition 5.7 or move right to finish on easier terrain. Note that Old Tradition ascends a smaller and easier overhang to the left. To descend, rappel the route or walk left (west) and downclimb a short (10') class 4 section at the end of the rock.
content.protection: Cams up to 1.5". At the top there is an unnecessary double-bolt anchor with quick links for rappelling (good cracks for gear).
content.location: Rock just uphill from War Party and The Chief, and below Hummingbird Spire. The route is several feet to the right of Old Tradition.a.k.a. the third rock up from shute-mills main wall that Mystery Hole is on. (Rock at 38.651467, -122.618525)P.S. There is also a nice afternoon shade spot near here

content.description: This is the obvious little spire to the right of Far and Farther and above Synchronicity. There may be a couple routes on it, but the obvious easy line is up the north side. Climb the short hand crack, an easy solo, to the top where you'll find one bolt and a crack that takes gear.
content.protection: Hand size crack. One bolt on top.
